## GoongGeocoder

A geocoder component using the [Goong Geocoding API][40]

### Parameters

-   `options` **[Object][41]** 
    -   `options.accessToken` **[String][42]** Required. An API Key created at [https://account.goong.io][43]
    -   `options.origin` **[String][42]** Use to set a custom API origin. (optional, default `https://rsapi.goong.io`)
    -   `options.goongjs` **[Object][41]?** A [goongjs][44] instance to use when creating [Markers][45]. Required if `options.marker` is `true`.
    -   `options.usefocalLocation` **[Boolean][46]?** This boolean prioritizes results that are close to the map's center location.
    -   `options.zoom` **[Number][47]** On geocoded result what zoom level should the map animate to. (optional, default `16`)
    -   `options.flyTo` **([Boolean][46] \| [Object][41])** If `false`, animating the map to a selected result is disabled. If `true`, animating the map will use the default animation parameters. (optional, default `true`)
    -   `options.placeholder` **[String][42]** Override the default placeholder attribute value. (optional, default `Search`)
    -   `options.proximity` **[Object][41]?** a proximity argument: this is
        a geographical point given as an object with `latitude` and `longitude`
        properties. Search results closer to this point will be given
        higher priority.
    -   `options.trackProximity` **[Boolean][46]** If `true`, the geocoder proximity will automatically update based on the map view. (optional, default `true`)
    -   `options.collapsed` **[Boolean][46]** If `true`, the geocoder control will collapse until hovered or in focus. (optional, default `false`)
    -   `options.clearAndBlurOnEsc` **[Boolean][46]** If `true`, the geocoder control will clear it's contents and blur when user presses the escape key. (optional, default `false`)
    -   `options.clearOnBlur` **[Boolean][46]** If `true`, the geocoder control will clear its value when the input blurs. (optional, default `false`)
    -   `options.minLength` **[Number][47]** Minimum number of characters to enter before results are shown. (optional, default `2`)
    -   `options.limit` **[Number][47]** Maximum number of results to show. (optional, default `5`)
    -   `options.marker` **([Boolean][46] \| [Object][41])** If `true`, a [Marker][45] will be added to the map at the location of the user-selected result using a default set of Marker options.  If the value is an object, the marker will be constructed using these options. If `false`, no marker will be added to the map. Requires that `options.goongjs` also be set. (optional, default `true`)
    -   `options.render` **[Function][48]?** A function that specifies how the results should be rendered in the dropdown menu. This function should accepts a single [Predictions][40] object as input and return a string. Any HTML in the returned string will be rendered.
    -   `options.getItemValue` **[Function][48]?** A function that specifies how the selected result should be rendered in the search bar. This function should accept a single [Place Detail][49] object as input and return a string. HTML tags in the output string will not be rendered. Defaults to `(item) => item.formatted_address`.

### Examples

```javascript
var geocoder = new GoongGeocoder({ accessToken: goongjs.accessToken });
map.addControl(geocoder);
```

Returns **[GoongGeocoder][50]** `this`

### addTo

Add the geocoder to a container. The container can be either a `goongjs.Map` or a reference to an HTML `class` or `id`.

If the container is a `goongjs.Map`, this function will behave identically to `Map.addControl(geocoder)`.
If the container is an HTML `id` or `class`, the geocoder will be appended to that element.

This function will throw an error if the container is not either a map or a `class`/`id` reference.
It will also throw an error if the referenced HTML element cannot be found in the `document.body`.

For example, if the HTML body contains the element `<div id='geocoder-container'></div>`, the following script will append the geocoder to `#geocoder-container`:

```javascript
var geocoder = new GoongGeocoder({ accessToken: goongjs.accessToken });
geocoder.addTo('#geocoder-container');
```

#### Parameters

-   `container` **([String][42] | goongjs.Map)** A reference to the container to which to add the geocoder

### clear

Clear and then focus the input.

#### Parameters

-   `ev` **[Event][51]?** the event that triggered the clear, if available

### query

Set & query the input

#### Parameters

-   `searchInput` **[string][42]** location name or other search input

Returns **[GoongGeocoder][50]** this

### setInput

Set input

#### Parameters

-   `searchInput` **[string][42]** location name or other search input

Returns **[GoongGeocoder][50]** this

### setProximity

Set proximity

#### Parameters

-   `proximity` **[Object][41]** The new `options.proximity` value. This is a geographical point given as an object with `latitude` and `longitude` properties.

Returns **[GoongGeocoder][50]** this

### getProximity

Get proximity

Returns **[Object][41]** The geocoder proximity

### setRenderFunction

Set the render function used in the results dropdown

#### Parameters

-   `fn` **[Function][48]** The function to use as a render function. This function accepts a single [Predictions][52] object as input and returns a string.

Returns **[GoongGeocoder][50]** this

### getRenderFunction

Get the function used to render the results dropdown

Returns **[Function][48]** the render function

### getZoom

Get the zoom level the map will move to

Returns **[Number][47]** the map zoom

### setZoom

Set the zoom level

#### Parameters

-   `zoom` **[Number][47]** The zoom level that the map should animate to

Returns **[GoongGeocoder][50]** this

### getFlyTo

Get the parameters used to fly to the selected response, if any

Returns **([Boolean][46] \| [Object][41])** The `flyTo` option

### setFlyTo

Set the flyTo options

#### Parameters

-   `flyTo` **([Boolean][46] \| [Object][41])** If false, animating the map to a selected result is disabled. If true, animating the map will use the default animation parameters

### getPlaceholder

Get the value of the placeholder string

Returns **[String][42]** The input element's placeholder value

### setPlaceholder

Set the value of the input element's placeholder

#### Parameters

-   `placeholder` **[String][42]** the text to use as the input element's placeholder

Returns **[GoongGeocoder][50]** this

### getMinLength

Get the minimum number of characters typed to trigger results used in the plugin

Returns **[Number][47]** The minimum length in characters before a search is triggered

### setMinLength

Set the minimum number of characters typed to trigger results used by the plugin

#### Parameters

-   `minLength` **[Number][47]** the minimum length in characters

Returns **[GoongGeocoder][50]** this

### getLimit

Get the limit value for the number of results to display used by the plugin

Returns **[Number][47]** The limit value for the number of results to display used by the plugin

### setLimit

Set the limit value for the number of results to display used by the plugin

#### Parameters

-   `limit` **[Number][47]** the number of search results to return

Returns **[GoongGeocoder][50]** 

### setOrigin

Set the geocoding endpoint used by the plugin.

#### Parameters

-   `origin` **[Function][48]** A function which accepts an HTTPS URL to specify the endpoint to query results from.

Returns **[GoongGeocoder][50]** this

### getOrigin

Get the geocoding endpoint the plugin is currently set to

Returns **[Function][48]** the endpoint URL

### on

Subscribe to events that happen within the plugin.

#### Parameters

-   `type` **[String][42]** name of event. Available events and the data passed into their respective event objects are:-   **clear** `Emitted when the input is cleared`
    -   **loading** `{ query } Emitted when the geocoder is looking up a query`
    -   **results** `{ results } Fired when the geocoder returns a response`
    -   **result** `{ result } Fired when input is set`
    -   **error** `{ error } Error as string`
-   `fn` **[Function][48]** function that's called when the event is emitted.

Returns **[GoongGeocoder][50]** this;

### off

Remove an event

#### Parameters

-   `type` **[String][42]** Event name.
-   `fn` **[Function][48]** Function that should unsubscribe to the event emitted.

Returns **[GoongGeocoder][50]** this
